cyclone.name: HUMBERTO
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles ESE of Great Abaco Island
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn NNW on Sunday and then move northward just offshore the Florida–Georgia–South Carolina coast before recurving east-northeast into the Atlantic early next week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No U.S. landfall forecast – center expected to remain offshore of the Southeast coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect (previous Florida watch discontinued)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for the Northwestern Bahamas (excludes U.S. coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Florida northward to South Carolina likely to experience rain, gusty winds, high surf and rip currents as the storm passes offshore.
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤9%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts possible Sunday into early Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation under 3 ft possible at high tide; mainly elevated surf and rip currents.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of rain Sunday–Monday could total 2–4 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents affecting port approaches and pilot boarding areas.
